content: Yes, most major museums in New York City offer audio guides for visitors. They are usually available for rent or download from the museum's website or through a mobile app. Audio guides provide a more in-depth look at the art, history, and culture behind the exhibits, as well as provide additional insights from curators, artists, and historians. Some museums also offer guided tours led by experts, which can be a great way to learn more about the collections and exhibitions. You might want to check the museum's website or ask at the information desk to see what options are available.
